title: Tactical Manager
text:
Tactical Manager is a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> management simulator <a href="video%20game">video game</a> for the <a href="Amiga">Amiga</a>, <a href="Atari%20ST">Atari ST</a>, and <a href="DOS">DOS</a> platforms. It was developed by Camy and published by <a href="Black%20Legend%20%28company%29">Black Legend Software</a> in 1994.
Gameplay.
"Tactical Manager" is a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> management simulator that allows one to 46 players to play simultaneously. There are no set goals, but the aim is to manage a football team to be as successful as possible. To achieve this the player can pick the team, set tactics and buy and sell players.
Reception.
"Tactical Manager" received mixed reviews. <a href="CU%20Amiga">CU Amiga</a> magazine rated the game 87%, calling it "Extremely involving", while <a href="Amiga%20User%20International">Amiga User International</a> magazine rated it 45% and said that the game looks dated when compared to other management games available. Later on a new game called "<a href="Tactical%20Manager%202">Tactical Manager 2</a>" was released.
